Title: Object: La B. Vergine, S. Antonio Abbate, e S. Bernardo
Series: Il gran Teatro di Venezia (The great theatre of Venice)
Description: The Virgin seated on steps with the Christ child standing by her side, and below St Anthony Abbot sitting on the left, and St Bernard standing on the right with book in left hand and crozier in the other; after Giuseppe Porta, called Salvialti. c.1720 Etching
Curator's comments: From 'Il Gran Teatro ...', see 1855,0609.1161 for comment on series. Painting executed for the Dandolo chapel, San Francesco della Vigna (Venice), Venice. See D.McTavish, 'GP called Salviati', New York 1981, p.287-288, cat. No.23. For another impression, see 1923,0417.31.51
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Representation of: St Bernard of Clairvaux
Acquisition name: Purchased from: A E Evans & Sons
